thread.title: G30 BMW 5 Series ROI site up, launch on March 29
thread.title_full: G30 BMW 5 Series ROI site up, launch on March 29

author: Gerard Lye
title: G30 BMW 5 Series ROI site up, launch on March 29
text:
Home » Cars » G30 BMW 5 Series ROI site up, launch on March 29 G30 BMW 5 Series ROI site up, launch on March 29 / 2 comments 
The all-new G30 BMW 5 Series will be launched in Malaysia on March 29, 2017, according to a registration-of-interest (ROI) site put up by BMW Malaysia. 
The site doesn’t disclose a whole lot of information relating to car’s specifications, and only shows us the G30’s Remote 3D View and BMW Connected feature, along with snippets from the BMW’s marketing campaign that stars Scott Eastwood (Clint Eastwood’s son). 
However, previous sightings of the G30 in Malaysia have revealed that the 530i will be offered , and could come with the M Sport package and 19-inch M double-spoke style 664M alloy wheels. In 530i guise, power comes from the B48 2.0 litre turbo four-cylinder, which produces 252 hp at 5,200 rpm and 350 Nm from 1,450 to 4,800 rpm. 
As with the previous F10, we should also expect the 520d to be offered as well, whereby the 190 hp/400 Nm B47 2.0 litre turbodiesel is carried over from before. A ZF eight-speed automatic will be the transmission fitted on all variants. 
The G30 has already gone on sale in Thailand , with two CBU imported variants being made available – 520d Luxury and 530i M Sport. The former retails for 3,899,000 baht (RM490,294), while the latter is priced at 4,399,000 baht (RM553,168). 
Also shown in the ROI site is an upcoming contest that carries the hashtag #MY5UCCESS, which asks Malaysians: “What success is to you?” It also states that participants could stand a chance to win a weekend drive with an “all-new exclusive BMW model.”
